t: Amazon DynamoDB - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - Amazon DynamoDB is a managed NoSQL database service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It supports key-value and document data structures and is designed to handle a wide range of applications requiring scalability and performance. t: What is Amazon DynamoDB? - Amazon DynamoDB
s: As a fully managed database service, DynamoDB handles the undifferentiated heavy lifting of managing a database so that you can focus on building value for your customers. It handles setup, configurations, maintenance, high availability, hardware provisioning, security, backups, monitoring, ...

t: Amazon's Dynamo | All Things Distributed
s: October 2, 2007 - In two weeks we’ll present a paper on the Dynamo technology at SOSP, the prestigious biannual Operating Systems conference. Dynamo is internal technology developed at Amazon to address the need for an incrementally scalable, highly-available key-value storage system.

t: Amazon’s DynamoDB — 10 years later - Amazon Science
s: July 12, 2024 - Amazon DynamoDB was introduced 10 years ago today; one of its key contributors reflects on its origins, and discusses the 'never-ending journey' to make DynamoDB more secure, more available and more performant.

t: Dynamo (storage system) - Wikipedia
s: June 21, 2023 - Dynamo is a set of techniques that together can form a highly available key-value structured storage system or a distributed data store. It has properties of both databases and distributed hash tables (DHTs). It was created to help address some scalability issues that Amazon experienced during ...

t: Why Amazon DynamoDB Isn’t for Everyone
s: Amazon Dynamo now underlies much of Amazon.com and defined an entirely new category of key-value store databases — “NoSQL”. In 2012, AWS announced the availability of DynamoDB as a fully managed NoSQL data service to customers with the promise of seamless scalability.
